Even 10+ years later, this game still delivers a straight forward "clock in, and clock out" gaming experience. Join a game with friends, or folks online and off you go. No difficult settings to play around with, no load out to worry about. Jump in, and then jump out when you finish. Tons of custom maps courtesy of the community to keep things interesting. Action, adventure, and straightforward gameplay. Fun for the whole family.

Left for dead came out on the 17 of November, 2008 and makes you take the role of one of one of the 4 survivors,  William Bill Overbeck, Francis, Louis, and Zoey. The story is fairly simple. You must travel across the Eastern United States in a zombie outbreak that started 2 weeks ago. You must travel from Philadelphia to Georgia while fighting waves of zombies and locating safe room to re-group in. As survivors in this game come across help to get to Georgia, the group always finds out that their pilot, driver, or captin, are already infected and have to stop the trip halfway. They then have to go on foot and find another survivor to help them to further get themselves to Georgia. Once in Georgia, they find out that the military isn't there to help fellow survivors, but to kill everyone outside military jurisdiction. Bill, Francis, Louis, and Zoey find a train and make it to a shoreline. Once their, they make there way to a bridge and restart generators to finally board a boat and leave to the Florida Keys. Once thing after another, one of the generators break and Bill sacrifices himself to help the other three. This is shown not only in the Sacrifice in both Left for dead and Left for dead 2, but also in the comic "The Sacrifice", taking place in the chapter Blood Harvest and The sacrifice chapter. Link: https://www.l4d.com/comic/index2.html . The gameplay in this game is also very simple, its a aim and shoot with some extra items here and there. I highly reccomend this game for story, lore, gameplay, and replayability. I give this game a 9.5/10!

Игра вышла в 2008 году от разработчиков Valve. Легендарную 1 часть ждали многие игроки всего мира. Игру должны запомнить многие. Графика хорошая, но во 2 части по лучше, увлекательные, сложные миссии, разные виды зомби, мало оружия, но хватает что бы убивать зомби. Суть все игры бегаешь, убиваешь зомби, и выполняешь задания.

I vastly prefer the group and levels of the first Left 4 Dead, but there is no reason to buy it anymore. If you didn't know, Left 4 Dead 2 includes all the campaigns from this game, with added melee weapons, a new throwable, and multiple new special infected.

Left 4 Dead 2 also has the workshop, which can bring this games one unique survival map into it. Don't buy Left 4 Dead unless you are on a nostalgia trip, go buy the second one.

There is no game in existence that is anything like this.  3200 hours over the course of like what, 13 years or whenever this game came out,  I really only play versus now.

The way you play will contribute to your team's success or demise.

This game still has plenty of toxic players.  Take a deep breath, don't get tilted.  Watch how other people play.  Emulate them.  If your team lost, and you find yourself blaming everyone else, it was probably your fault.  If you can't skeet, then clear quickly.  It's pretty hard for the boomer to go first in an open area, you need a hunter or two to distract survivors first.  Don't be the first to pull down a hallway, because the hunters will have a hard time pouncing around your pull.  It's quicker to clear the horde of of each other than every man for themselves.

I've never seen a game that rewards situational awareness and teamwork like this.  I still play it, and run an ok versus server for it.  In L4D1, the quality of the game experience relies on how well your team works together.  And it's always a little bit different, which is why I'm still playing the same maps over and over a decade later.
